page.title: 09 LOCAL HISTORY PART 4
page.content:
...is thought to have been built at a later date. Mr. George Stevens, of the highways department, happened to be passing the scene shortly after the accident and cleared the rubble from the road. Mr. Stevens, who remembered drawing water from the well for his father's traction engine before the war, told the "Standard" that only the previous night he had thought thit might be a good idea to erect a safety post near the well to reduce the possibility of accidental damage.
N.B.NO PAGE 8 DUE TO PROGRAM ERROR...
A year later the reconstruction work was under way and the paper reported as follows.... "A photograph published of the Beehive Well before it was demolished has helped bricklayer Bill..
